segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I need all of you to roll a d4.
segments.summary: Combat begins with a d4 roll for all players

segments.speaker: Luis (Azune)
segments.content: Oh.

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: What?

segments.speaker: Robbie (Kattigan)
segments.content: Ooh.

segments.speaker: Luis (Azune)
segments.content: This is not what I thought was going to happen.

segments.speaker: Travis (Teor)
segments.content: Okay.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: What did we get? Four. Four. Two. Two. Two. Two. Four. I'm going to need Azune and Kattigan to each give me a death saving throw.
segments.summary: Players report d4 results, Azune and Kattigan must make death saves

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Overhead, arrows fly through the sky. (swishing) Nearby, Loza Blade, about 12 or 13 years younger than the last time we saw her, cries out as, thump, thump, two arrows go into her shoulder. You see that she takes a small axe off a holster under an arm and (grunts) hucks it across a battlefield as an archer commander says, 'Another vol--' (grunts) Axe in the head, falls to the ground. She says, 'Get back under the hill!' And shoves a young Tunk, the boarman, who at this point is only about 16 years old, is a kid. '(snorts)' As he grunts and snorts back into the waiting darkness.
segments.summary: Description of young Loza Blade in battle, killing an archer commander and protecting young Tunk

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see overhead (hissing) a rippling spiral of green necromantic energy (crackling) shoot overhead. Far away from you see your friend Milo looking up and saying, 'Everyone, keep moving for-- (gasps)' Skull. Gone. Dead, to the ground. Death saves from you two.
segments.summary: Necromantic magic kills Milo, death saves required from Azune and Kattigan

segments.speaker: Luis (Azune)
segments.content: Okay. Save, 19.
segments.summary: Azune succeeds death save

segments.speaker: Robbie (Kattigan)
segments.content: Fail, seven.
segments.summary: Kattigan fails death save

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Kattigan, on the ground, describe your character for us in this moment and describe the injury that is starting to bleed out past the point of repair.
segments.summary: DM asks Kattigan to describe his critical injuries

segments.speaker: Robbie (Kattigan)
segments.content: Oh yeah, he's (groans) sliced up. Basically, he's always fighting low so all of his injuries are up high in his body. Shoulders, neck, he's got puncture wounds super close to lungs and heart. He's jacked from the waist up mostly, yeah.
segments.summary: Kattigan describes severe upper body wounds near vital organs

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Azune, where are you? And how do you look in this distant memory?
segments.summary: DM asks Azune to describe himself in the flashback

segments.speaker: Luis (Azune)
segments.content: I am 15 years old. I'm young. I'm shorter, I'm skinnier, and the last thing I remember before the lights went out was struggling to keep up with my group, these two guys, grown men at this point in my life that I've grown to emulate in a way. I saw how Teor blocks things with his shield and the way that Kattigan fights with his weapon, and the noise, the screams, and-- I wasn't ready for that, and the smell of blood, and I misstepped. And next thing I know, the lights were out. I don't even know what hit me.
segments.summary: 15-year-old Azune describes being overwhelmed in battle while trying to emulate Teor and Kattigan

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see overhead (crackling) the sky darkens as two sorcerers of the Sundered Houses fly under their own power. (whooshing) One of them drops through the sky, looks across the battlefield. (swishes) A tiny mote of light, as time almost slows. I'm going to need everybody here to roll initiative.
segments.summary: Two enemy sorcerers appear and initiative is rolled

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: What did we get, Azune? I got a six. What did we get, Teor? 18. What did we get, Thimble? 15. What did we get, Kattigan? Twinsies. 18.
segments.summary: Initiative order: Teor and Kattigan (18), Thimble (15), Azune (6)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Much like before, Kattigan and Teor are going to act on the same initiative. I'll remind you, Teor-- Big cats. I'll remind you, Teor, unfortunately for you, my friend, you're 1st-level. It's your turn. What do you do?
segments.summary: Teor's turn begins, he's 1st level in this flashback

segments.speaker: Travis (Teor)
segments.content: I try and spot-- Jesus. Can I see both Kattigan and Azune down on the ground?
segments.summary: Teor looks for his fallen comrades

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yes, you can. Give me a medicine check.
segments.summary: DM asks for medicine check to assess injuries

segments.speaker: Travis (Teor)
segments.content: Oh, that's a natural 18 for a dirty 20.
segments.summary: Teor rolls very high on medicine check

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Dirty 20. Triage. You've learned enough about medicine working for Loza. Over your shoulder, you see a dwarven woman. You see she's got a thick, braided beard, an empty upper lip; a thick, braided beard. You see that she leans down, reaches into a satchel, takes out a small dwarven poultice, crushes it in her hand. A red mist surrounds her as she punches into the empty hole created by a spell in your comrade Lucia's chest. She's got an open cavity, ribs exposed. Punches into it and says, 'All that is broken can be mended! Come on, girl, you're not done fighting yet!' Rips her fist out and leaves a bunch of the flesh from her own fist, stitching up Lucia's body as your dwarven medic gets her up on her feet.
segments.summary: Norma the dwarven medic dramatically heals Lucia with magical medicine

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Norma turns to you and says, 'Remember, look at them! Gut, bad. Limbs, they can stay!' And as you look out and see Azune and you see Kattigan, you see that Azune's injury is all shoulder and chest muscle and Kattigan's got something that's bad and bleeding. That's your medicine check.
segments.summary: Norma gives medical advice and Teor assesses his allies' injuries

segments.speaker: Travis (Teor)
segments.content: Got it. I'll try and search the air for Thimble. Any sight of her?
segments.summary: Teor looks for Thimble in the sky

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Overhead, you see near where Loza is closer to the top of the hill, running down the trench as fast as possible, you see Thimble coursing down towards you with Thjazi right behind her. You see Thjazi's got something in a dirty tarp wrapped up over and over and over again. Looks like he's sprinting. '(panting)' He here is about late 20s, '(panting)' running as fast as he can. You see he's got about eight gilded, gem-studded staves and wands wrapped up in a tarp '(panting)' as fast as he can. But you see Thimble is way ahead of them.
segments.summary: Thimble and young Thjazi approach, Thjazi carrying wrapped magical items

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: I'm lit up and trying to lead the way.
segments.summary: Thimble describes her actions

segments.speaker: Travis (Teor)
segments.content: I'm going to call out to Thimble: We need to close ranks! And I'm going to run towards Kattigan as fast as I can and just try and put pressure on the main chest cavities.
segments.summary: Teor calls for formation and rushes to help Kattigan

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Using your action, give me a medicine check. The difficulty is 10.
segments.summary: Medicine check required to stabilize Kattigan

segments.speaker: Travis (Teor)
segments.content: A natural 16 for an 18.
segments.summary: Teor succeeds medicine check

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You lean down. Reaching into a bag, Norma's magical healing is great, and she is one dwarf. And so you reach down. And just grab gauze, rag, wrap it around, staunch the bleeding. Kattigan stabilizes.
segments.summary: Teor successfully stabilizes Kattigan with field medicine

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: We return here to Dol-Makjar, the eastern edge of Kahad. That's right. I'm opening the episode with the butt-kicker in the table.
segments.summary: Brennan opens the episode with humor about starting with action

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Upstairs in Halandil Fang's office, side by side with Thaisha Lloy, you stare at shuddering flakes of black ceramic curved in outline like a shattered mask, dancing under the vibrations of the table. Closer and closer together. Downstairs, in the funeral, Vaelus, wandering elf from the Mournvale coming and seeking a stolen artifact, Bolaire of the Lloy Wing, a curator of artifacts, Murray Mag'Nesson, a dwarven wizard of the Penteveral, and Sir Julien Davinos, a vassal of the House Royce, all hear a shaking and shuddering elsewhere in the home as you look around and see the guests, look and see if anything strange or unusual has occurred. In this moment, we cut back upstairs. Hal and Thaisha, what do you do?
segments.summary: Description of the scene with the ceramic mask fragments upstairs with Halandil and Thaisha, while the funeral continues downstairs
segments.location: Halandil Fang's office and funeral below

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Halandil, I don't know what I brought. I'm-- what?
segments.summary: Thaisha expresses confusion about the artifact

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam)
segments.content: Thai, what are we looking at?
segments.summary: Halandil asks about the object

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: It looks like a mask. I don't-- Thjazi asked me to get this. Occtis and I, when were in Venatus, this is what we were meant to find and bring back. I was supposed to hand it off to Bolaire.
segments.summary: Thaisha explains the artifact's origin and purpose

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam)
segments.content: Are we still-- GM, are we looking at remnants still, the fragments, or have they formed?
segments.summary: Halandil asks about the current state of the fragments

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: They have no longer formed, but they did, for what it's worth, shudder inward towards the center, towards each other.
segments.summary: The fragments moved toward each other but haven't reformed

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: If I reach forward with one and just nudge two pieces together--
segments.summary: Thaisha considers touching the fragments

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Give me a constitution saving throw.
segments.summary: Brennan calls for a constitution save from Thaisha

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Natural one.
segments.summary: Thaisha rolls a critical failure

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam)
segments.content: Hal's hand did snake out to her wrist. I don't know if that is going to continue over to me, but--
segments.summary: Halandil attempts to stop Thaisha

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hal, you had a 13 dexterity? Give me a DC 13 sleight of hand check.
segments.summary: Brennan calls for a sleight of hand check from Halandil

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam)
segments.content: That's only a 10.
segments.summary: Halandil fails the check

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Thaisha, you touch one of the flakes and, Hal, what you see immediately in this moment is, first of all, everybody downstairs hears-- As, Thaisha, you touch this fragment in the center, the fragment drops through the velvet, which, itself, the velvet drops into a conical swirling mist. The mist spirals down, spreading as the velvet magically transmutes into mist, swirling down, down, down, as the fragments instantaneously fall in until every velvet or lining of this box is instead thick, ice-cold mist, and amongst the fragments that disappear and the fabric, the other thing that disappears in this moment is your consciousness as you collapse to the ground. You take one point of falling damage.
segments.summary: Thaisha touches the fragment causing magical effects and falls unconscious

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam)
segments.content: So mechanically, dropped to unconscious?
segments.summary: Halandil confirms Thaisha's condition

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam)
segments.content: Hal falls to his knees, scoops underneath.
segments.summary: Halandil tries to catch Thaisha

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam)
segments.content: No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no. His arms are going to run down along her arms, and he will say one word, and nobody hears it, because I'm alone with my unconscious baby mama, but he just says the word "stay," but it reverberates. It echoes low as I cast Healing Word.
segments.summary: Halandil casts Healing Word on unconscious Thaisha

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Incredible. So you say "stay." You heal one hit point of damage. As you say "stay," I think Thaisha, in unconsciousness, your eyelids flicker. The sclera and pupils of Thaisha's eyes are a roiling, cool mist. Everybody downstairs--
segments.summary: Thaisha is healed but her eyes show mystical effects

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I'm going to start walking upstairs.
segments.summary: Vaelus decides to investigate the noise

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: I am going to push past-- this nun, because hell no.
segments.summary: Bolaire pushes past Vaelus to go upstairs

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha)
segments.content: Hey, do you guys think that we should-- And there they go. All right. I guess, yeah, I'll follow.
segments.summary: Murray hesitates then decides to follow the others

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As you head up, you see that Shadia is also going to run upstairs as well. Olgud looks, seeing a bunch of you all head up, and goes, "(stammering) Nobody else!" He gets on the stairs and tries to play defense. This is an aging theater producer who looks at this armored elven warrior and is like, "I don't--
segments.summary: Multiple people rush upstairs while Olgud tries to stop them

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I think, if I say don't go up there, she'll listen, and just boxes everybody else out. However, Murray, you want to head up there. Julien, what are you doing?
segments.summary: Brennan describes the situation and asks Matt what Julien is doing

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Julien's going to stay below and more or less interpose himself between Lady Aranessa and whatever this might be up the stairs. He just kind of keeps a keen eye.
segments.summary: Julien positions himself protectively between Lady Aranessa and potential danger

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She says, "Is everything all right?"
segments.summary: Lady Aranessa asks about the situation

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: We don't know yet, but let other people get in the front of danger before us, and if it gets bad, we'll leave immediately.
segments.summary: Julien explains his cautious approach to Lady Aranessa

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She looks up and goes, "Ever valorous, Sir Julien."
segments.summary: Lady Aranessa comments on Julien's noble nature

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: So, Bolaire, Vaelus, and Murray, you rush up the stairs. Shadia looks at you, Hal, and goes, "Dad, Mom!" And reaches down to look into Thaisha's eyes. The three of you-- Bolaire, you see the box, mist. There is no longer anything in the box other than mist that stops swirling and now is just lined with thick fog.
segments.summary: Three characters rush upstairs while Shadia tends to her parents; Bolaire sees the mysterious box filled with mist

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: Can I roll an arcana check to see if I know what the fuck is happening?
segments.summary: Taliesin asks to roll arcana to understand the situation

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Let's do it. 15 gets you something. 20 gets you more, 25 gets you everything.
segments.summary: Brennan sets the DC tiers for the arcana check

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: That's, hold on. Yes. Double 18s. So that's 18, 19, 20, 21. 25. 24, sorry. 18, 19, 20, 21, 22. 24.
segments.summary: Taliesin rolls a 24 for arcana

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: So, you look and see here, it's a silver box. It's about yea big. You know, it's not a music box. It's large. It's not solid silver, but the plates that adorn what you believe to be a wooden box, looking at it, just in terms of its construction, so it looks more like the silver is in solid plates. It's warped. You recognize this language as an archaic, heightened version of Kessian, which is a halfling language, interspersed with certain Celestial glyphs.
segments.summary: Brennan describes the silver box's construction and the ancient languages inscribed on it

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You recognize some terms on it. There is a word here. One of the words that's written here is "Obsidia" in Celestial, which is an archaic, no longer used term for the Tenebral Reaches. Prior to the Shapers' War, the realm of death was as a shifting veil of shadow, a momentary darkness passed through on the way to the realms of final rest, the halls of the gods.
segments.summary: Brennan explains the term Obsidia and the nature of death realms before the Shapers' War

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: The underworld used to be a metaphysical clearinghouse, a momentary place for souls to travel, and legends of the undead in ages of Aramán past were the stuff of myth and legend. To have a spirit so powerful that it could resist the resting places ordained by the gods was something of profound magic. Obsidia was a term for that veil.
segments.summary: Brennan describes the historical nature of the underworld and undead in ancient Aramán

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: It was a Celestial term for that veil, but you would be well aware that, after the Shapers' War, what was a curtain expanded slightly. As the gods were destroyed, their realms of rest vanished. In the worst instances of catastrophe and doom-saying by the population, some believe that they were destroyed and all those eternal souls destroyed due to the hubris of the mortals that rose up against the gods.
segments.summary: Brennan explains the consequences of the Shapers' War on the afterlife

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Others that, you know, the clerics that have come since that work in theoretical metaphysics that Bolaire would be well aware of, believe that the afterlives are still out there, just untethered from Aramán currently. That's a matter of theology and conjecture and a lot of very flustered clerics would tell a worried mortal, "We're working on it."
segments.summary: Brennan describes current clerical theories about the missing afterlives

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You realize, as you're looking at it, this artifact, the silver plates are ancient, but you don't believe that this box is ancient. You believe that this was constructed with older materials, and you see it makes reference to Obsidia. The parts in Kessian refer to the realms of final rest, which would be a common parlance of the afterlives, the various halls of the gods, and you realize as you're looking at this and looking at this ancient halfling language on it, you're not looking at a box. You're looking at a coffin.
segments.summary: Bolaire realizes the silver box is actually a halfling coffin made from ancient materials

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: Ooh. It's halfling?
segments.summary: Bolaire confirms the coffin is halfling-sized

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Halfling-sized. About that big is a coffin for a halfling.
segments.summary: Brennan confirms the size of the halfling coffin

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: Oh boy. What happened?
segments.summary: Bolaire expresses concern and asks what happened

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Thaisha just showed me this and she opened it, and here we are.
segments.summary: Hal explains that Thaisha opened the coffin

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: I'm just saying, if you guys wanted to hot-box the place, it would've been nice to share and get an invite.
segments.summary: Murray makes a joke about the misty situation

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I don't think you want some of the smoke I just got, but thanks.
segments.summary: Thaisha responds to Murray's joke with her own

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Are you okay?
segments.summary: Vaelus asks if Thaisha is alright

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Mm-mm.
segments.summary: Thaisha indicates she's not okay

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Thaisha, give me a perception check.
segments.summary: Brennan asks Aabria for a perception check

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I'm afraid. Oh, the dice do go higher. How fun. Plus seven. 25.
segments.summary: Aabria rolls a 25 for perception

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As you look up and see Vaelus, the mist begins to leave your eyes, but as you look at her, you hear a distant bird song of a bird that you as a druid know is not native to this part of the world. You hear the call of a nightingale, distantly.
segments.summary: Thaisha hears the call of a nightingale that shouldn't be in this region

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Night song.
segments.summary: Thaisha identifies the nightingale's call

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: What happened?
segments.summary: Bolaire asks what happened

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I-- He already said it. Get out of my face. We opened the box. I touched part of the remnants of what looked like a mask, and then I died a little bit, and now I'm here, and everyone's a little too close to me right now.
segments.summary: Thaisha explains she touched mask remnants in the box and had a near-death experience

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: One breath at a time.
segments.summary: Hal tries to calm Thaisha

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: You touched a mask in an ancient silver coffin.
segments.summary: Bolaire restates what Thaisha did

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: A little, and I've learned an important lesson here.
segments.summary: Thaisha acknowledges she learned a lesson

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: I'm not normally a gambling woman, but I'd be willing to bet my left tit that this has something to do with whatever this fancy lady wants.
segments.summary: Murray suspects the coffin is connected to Lady Aranessa

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Right, above table, what's the fancy lady doing right now in this moment?
segments.summary: Liam asks what Lady Aranessa is doing

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I am taking in the scene, mostly focusing on how Thaisha and Shadia, them as a family, and watching Shadia care for her mother.
segments.summary: Ashley describes Vaelus observing the family dynamics

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Give me an insight check.
segments.summary: Brennan asks Ashley for an insight check

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Oh boy. Which one do I pick? Okay, okay, okay, okay. I'm going to do this one.
segments.summary: Ashley chooses dice and rolls

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I'll also say, in this moment of privacy, Hal, you're looking at Bolaire here. Bolaire, you're looking at this box. It is-- On that 24, you know there are things here that are escaping your attention at the moment, but you know where you have resources to dig in, where you have research and knowledge specifically about objects of this construction.
segments.summary: Brennan notes that Bolaire knows where to research the coffin further

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: Is the box closed right now?
segments.summary: Bolaire asks about the current state of the coffin

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Looks like you took a nasty spill.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Thank you. And I'm going to grip your hand just a little too tight on the way up and pull.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As Murray and Bolaire head out, you see that Aranessa turns to you, Hal, and says, "Are you going to be all right here?" And eyes over to Vaelus. "If you need anything, I think Sir Julien and I will return to the Davinos estate."

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: I'm going to look at Vaelus. No, the visitor and I don't have any grievance.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: We do not.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: I have nothing to hide in my house.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: That's good to know.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As the night winds down, Julien, you see Murray and Bolaire heading off to his carriage. and taking off (whoosh)--

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: That's a heavy son of a bitch.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: -- across the river towards the Lloy Wing and then Julien, Aranessa turns to you. "Are we done here?"

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: I believe our business is concluded, yes. Let us get to safer spaces. I'll turn to Hal and go: Halovar, I thank you kindly for your hospitality.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Always and for all.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Murray and Bolaire jump into either side of a carriage headed to The Archanade across the river in, I believe, the neighborhood of-- (hums) This would be, yeah, this is in Marud. Oh, sorry, no, this is Lugzash across the river. As you head across the river, I think Bolaire, you have a moment in your finery turning to look at the wide-brimmed hat of this dwarven wizard across from you. You guys have been in contact before but now you both head to the museum together.
segments.location: Lugzash, en route to The Archanade

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Charming night.

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: Isn't it just?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: We see another carriage pulling away from the funeral. (laughter) As Julien, you get into the back of the carriage with the Lady Aranessa who goes, who looks in and says, "That dwarven woman with gemstone teeth."

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: She is a lot, you are not wrong.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Well, she was absolutely right. Thjazi would've loved all this crazy shit happening at his funeral.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: It seems like even in death, his machinations linger. I don't trust what's happening in that house.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "No, no, I suppose I don't either, but I don't know if I trust what's happening in ours either. General Raimond, I believe, should be waiting for us back at the manor."

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: (sighs) Wonderful.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Be good to see your father again. It's been awhile."

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Sure.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Were you able to pay your respects?"

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Yes. His demeanor has definitely darkened at the mention of his father and he looks out the window of the carriage with his hand on the hilt of his sword now, his jaw tensing for the rest of the ride in quiet.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: We move from this place, we'll say farewell to our friends Bolaire, Murray, and Julien.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Pew, pew, pew, pew.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As we move forward in time to the end of the funeral. Many of the last fires have died down to ember. Many of the guests have left. I think, Hal, I don't know who would still be, basically who would still be here to help clean up at the end: Shadia, Olgud?

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: It would be members of the troop.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yeah. I think if you're looking at members of the troop, it's Olgud. There's a much older woman here, Niveda, who's helping, looking around and saying: "Absolutely darling time that you all had here. It's been so tragic, you know? I think theater is at its best when--" She's got this hair tied up in this gorgeous to-do. It's all black but it's a lot of frills and puffed shoulders and just goes, "I've always thought that the theater was at its best when there was a skosh of a criminal element, and to think that Thjazi won't be around anymore. Let me help with these platters." Goes to gather them up.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Well, we are one inch removed from my brother's world. I eye Vaelus, who's still here with just the closest people to the family still here and trickling out, Just permit me a few more moments. I'd really like to get over the whole strangers thing. One second. Hero, honey.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hero comes over to you, as you see Elodie is preparing to leave as well. Hero comes over and goes, "Dad?"

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Do you have your lyre?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Yeah. Do you want me to get it? I can go get it."

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Yeah, grab it.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She runs over and grabs a small lyre, brings it over. Elodie stands near the door but seeing this, takes a seat and smiles.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I'm trying to pass off a platter of cranberry rolls to Elodie.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Elodie goes, "Oh, I couldn't."

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: No, I insist. I insist.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She looks and sees stacks of cranberry rolls and goes, "I'll bring them."

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Thank you.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "I'll take them."

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Thank you.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "I'll throw these out."

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: I look around at the last few people in the room and taking in you as I say this: I find it pretty appropriate that my brother's last day is as full of drama as it was, in death even as in life. I think tensions ran hot in our home today and there are many things I could say but instead, I'll let my daughter and I speak in a way that's best for Thjazi. And I grab my own lyre from off of a mantelpiece here. Hero, play "Broken Wing."

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: back to land again on Thjazi's chest, Thimble, you look under his chest and you see there's a couple different necklaces. A lot of thieves and scoundrels, you know, collected little bits of jewelry from here and there, but you see that his silver necklace is kind of bunched up that has his old wedding ring on it, that he was wearing around his neck, and I think there's a moment where, Hal, you're standing nearby and you just remember being in a tiny little tower room of Castle Royce, two young guys, orcish commoners from Dol-Makjar in this nobles' wedding, and your brother dressed in (laughs) gifted finery looking at you and being like, "I'm nervous. I don't know why I'm so nervous. I can't. (stammers) N-n-none of this fits. I'm getting a noble's coat on loan from my fiancee's family." And a knock at the door and her hand over her face, the Lady Aranessa going, "I'm not looking, I'm not looking." Your brother looking, saying, "I can't see *you.* I can still see you right now if you cover your eyes, and she's like, "I don't know how it works. I've never been married before." Holding this gorgeous flower Holding this gorgeous flower that looks like it's either foxglove or prickle poppy, this gorgeous flower, and she says, "In our tradition, I'm supposed to-- It's for you. It's a wedding gift. You should have it before the ceremony. And the flower opens. (poof) And with that ring on a little table beside Thimble, for the very first time in the mortal world (poof) looking much different than she does today, appeared in that moment as Thjazi looks down at you and goes, "Hi."
segments.summary: Thimble finds Thjazi's wedding ring on his necklace, triggering Hal's memory of Thjazi's wedding where he first met Thimble when she appeared from a magical flower gift from Lady Aranessa

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Oh, hi.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Sorry, the fairy's a gift? I don't agree with any of this."

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: You know, I think it's kind of weird myself, but.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Do you want to be a gift? You don't have to be a gift if you don't want to be a gift."

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Just shut up and say thank you.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Thank you. Thank you to you, frankly. I don't know--" and you see-- (laughter) And Aranessa says, "Of course it's not like that! It's just, she's free. If you wish, then you marrying into the family have the protection of the fae, and as our family has enjoyed, Thimble is a warrior fairy from the gardens."

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: I can kill a bunch of mice in your house. Also, I'm really good at braiding hair. (nervous laugh)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Thjazi goes, "Is that related? Are those skills from one and the same-- No, you know what? Now, here's what you really need to do. You need to catch a bunch of mice, braid their hair, keep everybody here on their toes."

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: We can do that?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "We can do anything."

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: I look at the Lady Aranessa. I think I'm going to really like it here. I'm going to really like him. And I'll fly over and land on his shoulder.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Lands on your shoulder and says, "Are they giving you a little outfit, too?"

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: I don't like this stupid dress, so if we can get something different, I'd be thrilled.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "We'll go to a dollhouse upstairs and see what they got." (laughter)

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Over my shoulder to Aranessa, I say: I think you just bought yourself a lot of trouble.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Oh god. Everything about this is ill-advised." As you hear her in this memory, "Everything about this is ill-advised," You're just looking at the stubble on his face, the ring on the necklace. You remember that first little, the whole wedding was delayed because he wanted to get you something from the dollhouse that you would enjoy wearing before you had to go down the aisle.
segments.summary: The memory continues, showing Lady Aranessa's concerns about the arrangement, while focusing on Thjazi's care for Thimble

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Touch the ring. We have to make this right and nothing's ever going to be right again. I don't know how to do it.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Occtis walks up next to the body. We'll figure it out. We can figure it out. Figure out what went wrong.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: You grew up.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Ah. I guess so did you, although you're not any bigger.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I think I take that opportunity to make eye contact with Azune and Teor and just, not wordlessly, but as quietly as possible to hold space for this moment: Do you know what happened? We had a plan.

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: I look to Teor, and I look back towards you, Thaisha, and I just give you a nod. And it was Hal's music playing with his daughter. Although it stopped, it's still sort of, I can still feel it in my ears, and I look over to Hal and suddenly I remember myself in a way in Hal's home, and with that music lingering and this very unexpected reunion of people that I met so many years ago, part of this rebellion, this fire that Thjazi had lit, (huffs) and I remember. Something about that look in Thaisha's face. (exhales) All the different ways that this could've gone wrong, and I walk towards Thjazi. And you're still on him? Thimble, I'm so sorry, but I need to check him. I need to see if the thing that pinged from me is still on him so I can compare it to the one that we found with you.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: I'll fly up in the air and hover about a foot above his body.

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: And I, as carefully as I can, I turn him over because my understanding is that it pinged in his back pocket, so I search for that which, that thing that pinged.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: I'll light up and try to go down to where Azune's looking and see if I can light up any area that.

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: I'll start to search him, and with you nearby, I do turn to you and I say: I'm sorry, Thimble. I lied to you earlier and I feel really badly about it. The moments that I had with Thjazi, they went by so fast, there wasn't much time for him to say anything to me about anybody, and I just saw how hurt you were when you realized what had happened and I just couldn't bear it, so I just wanted you to feel a little bit better.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: It's okay.

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: And I'll go back to searching.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Hal is struck by how thick the air in this room is with history and how his brother was something different to every person in this room. I can even tell those I've never met before today have a story with my brother, and that story has come to a close.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You reach into the back area of his coat. Give me an investigation check.

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: That is a 19.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Small inseam pocket. You know that there would be-- You can see in and see where the stitching would've been cut, one of the hems of the coat, you could slip and drop something in to this hidden pocket in the back of the coat. You reach in on a 19 and pull out what looks like a small cheap piece of ceramic. It has something scrawled on it, but it doesn't look-- it's not what Thimble made. And it's still registering to you that residue of magic that was on it. Give me an arcana check.
segments.summary: Azune finds a fake magical ceramic piece in Thjazi's hidden pocket - not the one Thimble made

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Standing there as well, can I?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Go ahead, yeah. Each of you give me an arcana roll. We'll call it difficulty of, I want to say 13.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Can I, since this is intentional, can I Guidance myself-- on this check? Thanks.

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Let's get more dice out.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: I'm going to stop. And I just shut it off.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: You said my brother's name. Cyd was working with you?

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Yes.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: How long has he been a part of your plan to try and save Thjazi?

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: How long?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Just for the past two weeks. because Thjazi got arrested two weeks ago.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Oh, for about two weeks, yeah.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: And he has been a reliable measure in this?

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: You say that like we-- That's surprising to you?

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: It's been years since I've seen my brother, but dependable is not always a word I would use to describe him.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Good, glad we brought him on board.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Perhaps things have changed, but you must be as alarmed as I am to not see him here.

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Yes.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Yep.

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: And you haven't seen him since you've entered?

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: It's been years, no.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Loza, who's right by your side as well, goes, "(grunts) Casimir was a young mercenary in the Torn Banner. You know, quiet type. I never knew Cas that well. By the time Cas joined up, I was already the commander. I know that Cas was-- He wasn't in Thjazi's unit either, but he worked the mess. So I think he knew everybody. Thjazi struck up a friendship with him there." Looks over and goes, "Cyd. I know when Cyd left, he headed west for Dol-Makjar, and I knew-- We'd had a problem with Cyd in the past. I mean, there were certain things that we weren't supposed to steal, you know? You win a battle. There are certain things that you can take as seized contraband and there are certain things that you have to leave. And Cyd was, this was a long time ago, Cyd was much younger, but I found him with stuff on him that he wasn't supposed to have."

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: He had sticky fingers.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah, nothing wrong with sticky fingers.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Who brought him in?

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: That.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Because I don't know anyone, so wasn't me.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: And how related were you to the planning of all of this?

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Super related.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Okay.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: I know everything about it.

segments.speaker: Laura and Aabria
segments.content: (chuckle)

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Start at step one and elaborate all the way to the end.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Thimble, I think you had almost no time to put this together.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: I didn't have anything to do with it. (laughter) I was busy!

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Sorry, wait.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: This is a wild change of story.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: But I would've known when Cyd came on board, right?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yeah, I think, Thimble, that the-- Casimir's the one that I feel the least sure about out of all of this. Cyd was way closer to Thjazi than Casimir was. The reason you had to use Casimir is that Casimir is a smuggler. He could get a wagon with a trick compartment. He could get you something on a road out. The plan was you get the glyph to Thjazi. Thjazi has a way to basically Misty Step through the wall into the hidden compartment of the wagon. Casimir was not going to be able to show up with the wagon, but Cyd worked as a driver. That was like his above, as like a coach, wagon driver. So he was going to get the wagon into position where it would be within that short distance through the wall, drive on out of there. And Occtis and Thaisha were going to not be anywhere near the execution because they're highly visible. Thaisha's a member of the Circle of Ancients. Occtis is a member of the House Tachonis. But that would be an asset getting out of the city if you weren't near the execution anymore.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Did anyone check on the wagon?

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: We never saw it.

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: The wagon never arrived.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: The wagon wasn't there? You're sure? Cyd was never there?

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: I wasn't there. That would be the two of you that were at that post.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: But what about the waiting point? The wagon never showed up to you, but was Cyd ever in the place that he was supposed to be?

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I don't know, we were supposed to stay far enough away that--

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Yes.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Azune, you would know that there would've been Revolutionary Guard within sight of that area of the wall. You can potentially check in with your fellow Arcane Marshals or guard members. It's middle of the night right now. But tomorrow, you'd be able to say, "Did anybody see a wagon pull up to this point?"

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: As that light bulb goes off, I'll turn to Teor. I can check in with the Arcane Marshals. I know people that had eyes where we expected Cyd to be. If you have another way, another lead to follow to search for your brother tonight, I will go with you. But if you don't, then we can wait until tomorrow morning when I can speak to someone that can give us some information.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: That would be best.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: And I should check in with the thieves' guild, see if Casimir--

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Right.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Loza says, "I think that's a good idea, Thimble, but if you're going to check on the thieves' guild, make sure that you are checking on them with some friends in tow. I don't know the city, I haven't been in Dol-Makjar." You see, here she turns you, Teor, and says, "I've had a long night here. Dol-Makjar, Teor, is-- The Grey Tower is asleep at the wheel. I mean, we've known for-- When the Revolutionary Council failed to come to the aid of the Falconer's Rebellion, we knew that things had become bad, but even in the last 12 years, it's worse. The council's asleep at the wheel. The Sundered Houses have moved in this Chamber of the Lords-Advisory."

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "The only voice slowing that-- they've passed laws against using magic in the marketplace. The only voice within the Sundered Houses that's been any kind of voice for moderation or slowing things down has been House Royce. And I spoke to Lady Aranessa during the funeral. She was made to wait for four hours, and then wasn't allowed an audience with the House of Halovar. Speaking of which, I made a little inroad for you with the kid. The shiny--"

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Wicander.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Oh.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Wicander. He's a total fool? Nincompoop?"

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Mm-hmm.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Can be, yeah.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: All good words.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Well, he's a lamb amongst lions. I got a bead on the kid. I asked if he required any security, mercenary aid with this presence in the city and Thjazi's execution, et cetera. So he seemed amenable to meeting with you tomorrow if you want to go check on him and see if there's any potential lead there. Halovar is in this. I wouldn't trust, no offense, kid, the Tachonis."

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: No, I get it.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "But Halovar is in it, but maybe doesn't care as much about Thjazi as the Tachonis do."

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Whatever happens, if you're trying to run down The Crow Keepers to see what they know, just make sure you don't go alone."

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: d says, "It's late. We're in Hal's home. I think it's time we said good night."

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Thank you for your, I would say hospitality, but thank you for giving us a place to gather.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: I know my brother would be glad to have you here today.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: We will follow up in the morning.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I'm going to go over to Thimble.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Mm-hmm.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: May I speak with you privately?

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: I'll fly up the stairs.

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: As that happens, I'd like to go over to Kattigan and I say to Kattigan: I need a word with you, please.

segments.speaker: Kattigan (Robbie)
segments.content: All right.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I sit down in one of the chairs in whatever room we're in and from behind the chair comes Pin, walks around and I go: You keep an eye on her. My vision goes into Pin's and he's going to follow Vaelus up the stairs.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Cool.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I'm very sorry. I can see that you cared about this person very much. I'm not here to hurt any of you.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: You didn't do this?

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: No, I did not. I try as much as I can to show her that I am not the person that caused his death. I'm not the bad guy here. This was something that was taken from me. I think we're on the same side. Someone who did let me in the city, his name is Bolaire.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: (forced exhale) Him.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Hm. (sighs) I look down and I see Pin, give him a wink.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: In the living room you just hear: Shit. (chuckling)

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Did she notice the fox following?

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: (laughs)

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Shut up. (chuckling)

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)

segments.content: I do.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Better than me, probably. Thjazi was great. He didn't keep me: he was my partner. We were equals. Can you believe that? Equals. (breathy laugh) I'm sorry I took your stone. I'm sorry it's lost.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: It's fine. I will find it again.

segments.content: (laugh)

segments.content: -- crouched down next to this fox, you see that its front right leg is of a red fox, but most of it is an arctic fox. It's got little patches. One of its ears is from a red fox. It's mixed of different pieces of foxes, but its eyes are two purple buttons--

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)

You see just with the fellow members of the former members of the Torn Banner, Kattigan, Azune, and Teor, you see Loza goes, "For this meeting with Halovar tomorrow, would you like company on the way there or do you prefer to do that alone?"

segments.content: She nods. She looks over to you, Thaisha. She invites you over to stand a little closer. Goes, "Tomorrow, I am retiring.

segments.content: n the hallway, to answer an appointment at the front gate, is the Aspirant Tyranny. Tyranny, as you tread the hall, by herself. SAM: Oh great. BRENNAN: As you tread to go, how is Tyranny feeling as she approaches the front gate? WHITNEY: (sighs) I feel good. I mean, I think that last night, it didn't go great, but at least Wick got his scimitar, and I think everybody kind of understood that his intentions were good. I'm glad I got him out of there before he got his ass kicked by Lady Aranessa. S...

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: I was rushing out to see what the commotion was, but upon seeing this, the breath is taken out of me, and I momentarily stumble and have to lean on Tyranny for a moment because I'm so taken by the almost painterly beauty of the moment. And clearly, this man has been touched by the Light.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: I'll also stand and rise. And as I turn, (wind whooshes)

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Oh shit.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: The mane hits in the wind and the gold of my eyes sort of fades. Post-nat 20.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Mm-hmm.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: (sexy snort)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: (laughs)
