segments.content: Whoa (laughs). That was so cool.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: That was very cool. Yes. (throat clear) What seems to be going on out here?

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Just a moment. And I help up the man.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: He looks up and says, "Oh, thank you kindly, sir. Are you-- are you a priest of the Light?"

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: A friend of the Light.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Oh. Pleasure, sir. Thank you. That's, that's marvelous. I was worried I'd lose my leg."

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: They have you transporting horribly-- How's this liquids-- What was this that you were moving?

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: That's nothing. No concern of yours. It's just, um, church business.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Church business.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: He says, "Sorry. The gentleman, Lord Wicander, he healed my leg, so I won't have to miss a shift of work. Everything will be all right. You won't have to--"

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Don't. Worry not. Just take this where it's going to, my father, or--?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "The Lord Godard has already said everything's well to do. We're to ship this out to Ezir first thing tomorrow. We're moving it down--"

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Excellent.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "-- to Caravan Hill right now."

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Make it so, and ever bright, ever right.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "May the Beam reach you, my lord. Thank you so much. I'm sorry for being injured." You see, he--

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Accepted.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: It is a truly wonderful thing to have people that are so devoted to you in their service. You must be an incredible man to work for.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Well, I--

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: The best.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Please, Tyranny, I must remain humble. Some have called me a great man to work for, sure. But I don't hear that, nor do I acknowledge it. It's just who I am and who we all aspire to be.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: It is wonderful to see you again. Please, allow me to reintroduce myself. My name is Teor Pridesire. And when I grasp his hand, it is iron tight and does not let go.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Mine. Mine is is like a raw cut of veal-- (laughter) -- just clammy and soft.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: I see one of his pinkies just flirting with the idea of dislocation--

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: (high-pitched, pained) Oh!

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: But just kind of--

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: (high-pitched, pained) Oh!

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: -- keeping it there.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Yes.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: I was so moved by your concern last night--

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: (high-pitched, pained) Oh!

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: -- and the raw, pure emotion that you showed over my friend, my fellow comrade. I wanted to thank you for that and see if we could speak a bit further about what it was that was making you so upset.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Tyranny, offer him your hand.

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Oh, can I also shake your hand? Actually, this is great. Hi.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: (gasps)

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Tyranny.

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Wow. Your hands are so big and rough. His hands are so soft. It's crazy.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Soft with the holiness of the Creed. Yes, it is a pleasure to meet you and yes, thank you for coming. I'm sure we can find a way to assist each other. I can guide you in any way you need to go and perhaps, you could be of assistance to my family as well.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: I would be very open to any such suggestion. I came here to serve the amazing Loza Blade, but obviously, my brother and others that know Thjazi have-- We have been waylaid by this. It is hard to know what to do next, but I saw in you kindred light.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Yes.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: The feeling that answers lie in that light. I knew that if I found you, I could find someone that would help me guide the others to that light.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: You see, Tyranny, when you carry yourself with goodness and justice, others see it, respect it, and hone in on it. Always carry yourself with respect, self-respect.

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Understood, Your Radiance.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Yes, I'm sure I can guide you to somewhere where your true heart can do its best. A friend of the Light is a friend of mine and please, come inside with us.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Thank you. That's most kind.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You enter into the manor and arrive up at your study. The Villa Aurora is beautifully appointed and you have a little bit of privacy here to discuss.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Mm-hmm, mm-hmm. Well, if I may ask, how were you friends with Thjazi? Well, if I may ask, how were you friends with Thjazi?

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Do you mind if I make myself comfortable?

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Sure, go ahead.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: I'll reach back and take the shield that's on my back and take it off. Underneath it, you'll see a giant golden flail with an angled head underneath it, and when I put it down, it weighs a lot. (thumping)

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Oh.

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: (chokes)

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: That's much better. Thjazi was a friend, but also a mentor. I looked up to him in the Torn Banner and the Falconer's Rebellion. It meant a lot to me and the people that I served with. But we had gone our separate ways over the years and Loza Blade and I were coming back to Dol-Makjar and we meant to find him and my brother, Cyd. Do you know him?

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar
segments.content: ht we were meant to forgive people like the Torn Banner and like Thjazi? Why couldn't we have spared his life?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "The Tachonis are moving and we need to move and keep up. Do you understand? They are our closest allies."

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar
segments.content: Sure.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "And that means that our backs are right within reach of their knives."

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar
segments.content: Oh.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Why are they still so strong? Their lands destroyed and sundered halfway between Stormwrack and Eternal Night. Why? What moves are they making on boards we can't see? Thjazi had to die because the Tachonis wanted him to die, and right now, we need them close. I still can't get my eyes on what exactly it is that they can do. You-- I've done you wrong. I've betrayed you."

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar
segments.content: No, not you. No, no, no, no. You speak only truth.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "I thought-- I thought it would be of great benefit to our house that our Scion to our house that our Scion should walk only in the Light, but there's nothing solid that doesn't cast a shadow."

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar
segments.content: Yes.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "I made a mistake and I've been making it and it's time to set things right. Don't make any plans for tonight. When your father returns, it's time for you to know the truth."

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar
segments.content: You mean to promote me?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Yeah, Wicky, you're getting promoted." And she opens the door and leaves.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: And that's where we'll take our break.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Oh.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: "Yeah, Wicky, you're getting promoted."

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hello and welcome back to the city of Dol-Makjar as we arrive at the next day after the funeral, the wake of Thjazi Fang. Light descends on The Archanade, a massive museum of many wings that lies in the neighborhood of Lugzash high up in the city near the headwaters of the River Vrosh. The Archanade actually can see its expanse, buttresses the river, a short cliff fall of about 20 feet into the surging waters. The higher up you get in altitude in the city, the more the waters are foam white and immediately deadly if you fall into them, just from falling into foam that you can't swim through. You look and see that The Archanade is this massive, spiring gray stone. Like a lot of the stone that was shaped in the ruins after the Shapers' War, this stone is flawless, smooth gray, almost polished to the touch, summoned by druids victorious in their defeat of the gods. For indeed the Old Path, as it is called, was very nearly erased from the existence of Aramán by the gods who sought for their millen
segments.summary: Chapter 2 begins the day after Thjazi's funeral. The scene opens at The Archanade, a massive museum in the Lugzash neighborhood near the River Vrosh's headwaters.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: nia of rule to be the only path by which mortals could access the divine. And yet, the Old Path did survive. The ancient smiths of the Lloy family, a family of orcish smiths native to Dol-Makjar crafted the first of the Pariah Blades, those swords that were used to defeat Azgra the Conqueror, Shaper of War. The Lloy Wing, so named for that family of orcs, is a beautiful wing of the museum dedicated to celebrating the revolutionary history of the Shapers' War. Taliesin, Bolaire, as the curator of the Lloy Wing, what do we see as we move into the dusty light and where do we find Bolaire within the Lloy Wing?
segments.summary: Brennan describes the Lloy Wing of the museum and its history, setting up Bolaire's location

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: Well, it's after hours, quite obviously. It is grand and has that echoey reverb of a institution with far too much money. Each exhibit stands in this large circular, the main-- The main room is this large circular room where the sword itself is up in the center, where the sword itself is up in the center, well lit with a series of small plaques around it. It's also-- Every exhibit, I should also say, is slightly magically enchanted so that when you walk up to it you start hearing the audio recording-- of what's there until you walk away, and then it silences itself so that you can maintain the quiet.
segments.summary: Bolaire describes the Lloy Wing's grand circular room with the central sword exhibit and magically enhanced audio displays

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Voices that would approach, the light (soft illumination) on a well-crafted but simple cold iron blade, so dull in its lack of ostentatiousness. It obviously never knew the touch of fire, was smithed carefully over time from raw ore through pure effort of metalworking, pounding of hammers again and again and again. It seems like the light from these magical cantrips as it touches it almost sinks into the blade as though this blade were so common that magical light could not even rest upon its fuller blade or edge. Off to the side in an open door we see an office, candles burned down to the very basin, and a silver coffin sized for halfling. On a desk, book and scrolls open, a sleepless Bolaire and Murray, here working in this place. You've been working all night. Go ahead and give me any skill checks that you would've thought to make during this night of working to look into this.
segments.summary: Brennan describes the Pariah Blade and reveals Bolaire and Murray working all night in an office with the halfling-sized silver coffin

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: Well, I would've had every indexed filed piece of paper that we have pulled out just so that we have the paperwork, so we don't have to go down into the archives. Everything that exists is a piece of paper.
segments.summary: Bolaire describes organizing all available documentation

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: Got a giant pile of those and a few clearly very old books piled up that we're looking through, including a translation, a book for translating some of the text on the coffin. Anything you would want me to pull?
segments.summary: Bolaire mentions translation books for the coffin's text

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Well, I would've done a very meticulous ritual casting of an Identify spell.
segments.summary: Murray describes casting Identify on the coffin

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: I think you almost see-- Murray's got gloves on and you see something that you might not have noticed before but she's got this, basically a little monocle that clips to the top of her hat, so it is now very precisely positioned to the front of her left eye. She has been using Mage Hand and taking the tip of her fingernail and almost using it to carve and do a half-assed autopsy on a big old box as she's been doing this all night. So I would, yeah-- Got to do-- do a nice little investigation here.
segments.summary: Murray describes her detailed examination setup with monocle and Mage Hand

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: There is a-- Oh, go ahead. What are you going to use, investigation? Oh, Identify. I will say also the object is sitting on a desk, and it's illuminated by bright limelight so that we can really see it. It's not candlelight. It is a bright chemical-- (blazing light) It's also sitting on some sigils that are clearly there so that if something goes horribly wrong it will contain it as best it can.
segments.summary: Bolaire describes the safety setup with bright lighting and containment sigils

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Question for you. Have you opened the box or left it closed?
segments.summary: Brennan asks about the coffin's current state

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: Until we know what it says on the outside, I would say not.
segments.summary: Bolaire confirms they haven't opened the coffin yet

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Yeah, I would've Identify before open.
segments.summary: Murray confirms using Identify first

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Bolaire, as curator here, you see wizardry at work, this craft of the Penteveral. I think seeing wizardry here, Murray, without any rolls necessary, the ethos of your school alive and well in your heart, there will be limits to how much truth you can glean if you don't look in that box. Now, it's extremely prudent not to open it. Far be it for me to tell you to open it. Actually, I would say even above table, I'm totally fine if you don't. But that conflict is here. The conflict of truth, great truth, at least in the philosophy of the Penteveral, requires some risk.
segments.summary: Brennan explains the philosophical tension between safety and seeking truth for Murray's school

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: We're at step one, though. This is step one. Then we will open.
segments.summary: Bolaire decides to proceed with opening the coffin

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Do you have one of those big flues, you know, like how sometimes you see them in laboratories and they kind of help like-- Because I know there's a whole bunch of bad mist that came out of this, so I just don't know if there's something, you know, for ventilation so we don't burn our eyeballs.
segments.summary: Murray asks about ventilation systems for safety

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: We have that. Yes. One second. I just open up a-- We have a vent system. Again, everything that we have seen happen, we build something to try and make it so it won't happen again. It'll help.
segments.summary: Bolaire confirms they have ventilation and safety systems

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You have everything set up. Do you cast your Identify spell just on the exterior of the box?
segments.summary: Brennan confirms the setup and asks about the Identify spell target

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: I hate you so much.
segments.summary: Murray expresses frustration at the difficult decision

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: I'm going to do something before we do this that she will not notice. Says me. I'm going to drift into the black box.
segments.summary: Bolaire secretly uses his ghostly abilities to check inside the coffin

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Says who?
segments.summary: Murray questions Bolaire's assumption

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Deterioration a little more rapid than-- Yeah. Moving through the space--
segments.summary: Brennan describes accelerated deterioration inside the coffin

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: We're going to open the box. Well we're going to take a nice distance. I'm going to Mage Hand. Open the box. Got all the windows open.
segments.summary: Murray decides to open the coffin using Mage Hand from a safe distance

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As you open it, once again, you see mist, (wafting mist) and have more of an understanding of how to engage in this way, in this moment. Your Identify spell moves throughout these silver plates. This is not an ancient artifact. This has been assembled very recently. As a craftsperson, what's bizarre is that the lining leaves only a sliver of what the lining would've been attached to, because the lining is now just open mist. But you do see enough wood that is well tended to. On that Identify, I think you can see that that wood actually might come from far up north. Go ahead and give me-- This is almost a tool proficiency check if you have one, or you can give me arcana as well, whichever you prefer.
segments.summary: The coffin opens revealing mist and Identify reveals it's recently constructed with northern wood

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Oh. Oh my goodness gracious. Where's Chetney when you need him? All right-- Yeah, I'll just do a straight arcana. That's not great. Better than mine. 14.
segments.summary: Murray makes an arcana check and rolls poorly

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: I have alchemist-- Using a tool just adds-- Well yeah, it's actually the same as my arcana so fuck it. That's 20.
segments.summary: Bolaire makes a successful check with his alchemist tools

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: 20. Dirty 20. You recognize this, having looked over this, the wood, the thin bit that you see, is at this point almost totally fossilized. This is recovered wood from the Wastes deep within the Wastes, shattered and fallen trees from the place where the Goddess of Life, the shaper of the elves died. Sylandri. But the plates are halfling. That Identify spell, Murray, as you begin to read the text, it translates all of the Kessian, all the Celestial. These plates are taken, being set into a massive-- There are some ancient halfling temples that were dedicated to their goddess Rauwyn, the Trickster. They would've been almost in hanging books of fabric or tapestry that in their holy places you would turn for a crowd to be able to read, almost like a massive storybook in a holy place or in a chapel. The plates have been taken off and affixed to this coffin. So the components are ancient, but the coffin is new.
segments.summary: Brennan reveals the wood comes from the Wastes where Sylandri died, and the halfling plates are from ancient temples to Rauwyn

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: The plates reference on that, and with the Identify, this is the coffin of Olbalad. Olbalad is a celestial who was sometimes called more colloquially by halflings, the Sister of Mists. She was effectively the halfling Angel of Death, a celestial that guided them through the mists on their way. So what your Identify speaks at in the writing here where you realize that some things-- It's not this vulgar, but the plating is almost like how you construct a ransom note out of pieces of a magazine. It's not that small in places, but the meaning of some of the runes has been changed by how they've been arrayed around the coffin. Olbalad was a celestial that was a psychopomp, took those that died into the realms of death to their final afterlife. So to have a coffin of a celestial that was supposed to guide you from life to death almost seems like a working of blasphemy in some ways, which has a very different context in a world that killed its gods 70 years ago. But the coffin of Olbalad is what this is now. It is not ancient, it's new. But that's what is written here.
segments.summary: The coffin is revealed to belong to Olbalad, the Sister of Mists, a celestial psychopomp who guided halflings in death

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: The last thing I'll say on that-- What did you roll for your check again, sorry? 14. You would know a very simple fact that is not too uncommon for wizards to know. After the gods died, the study of wizards concluded that there were beings that were older than the gods. The fairy, the fae had been around for much longer. Demons had always existed on Aramán in some way or another. Other ancient beings, old and connected to the spirit. They say that giants walked this world before the gods arrived, and the gods defeated them when they arrived here. There are some types of beings that were not here before the gods were here because they were called, or sung into being, or came from whatever realm the gods came from, and these were the celestials. Their roles, beautiful, ethereal. The heralds and servants and warriors of the divine, crafted from the power of divine might themselves. When the gods died, the celestials went feral and became ravening, like monsters. To see a celestial is to see death itself, and their presence is felt almost nowhere in the world for in the aftermath of the Shapers' War, to leave one on the loose or running was a death sentence for that region, essentially. This coffin claims to be the coffin for that celestial-- This coffin claims to be the coffin for that celestial-- Olbalad.
segments.summary: Brennan explains that after the gods died, celestials went feral and became monsters, making this coffin extremely dangerous

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Welp, I reckon we've got a problem on our hands.
segments.summary: Murray realizes the severity of their situation

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: We've got a very, very serious problem. I'm going to get a tool and gently scrape the inside to see if there's any what would pass for remains. Just the dust, organic dust.
segments.summary: Bolaire attempts to examine inside the coffin for remains

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Give me a difficulty 10 dexterity saving throw.
segments.summary: Brennan calls for a dexterity save as Bolaire examines the coffin

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: I'm patient. I'll give it 30 seconds.
segments.summary: Bolaire waits patiently for a response from the void

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Oh. We are so fucked.
segments.summary: Bolaire realizes the severity of their situation

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: I'll be a Shaper's anus. We got a pretty little relic on our hands.
segments.summary: Murray recognizes they've found a significant Shaper artifact

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: That was disgusting to say.
segments.summary: Bolaire reacts to Murray's crude expression

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: What do you think happens if I shove you in that void? I'm just kidding!
segments.summary: Murray jokes about putting Bolaire in the void

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Do you want to find out? Oh, I know you were just kidding. I would have murdered you on the spot.
segments.summary: Bolaire responds threateningly but acknowledges the joke

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: To each of you, this is a ton of information that now calls out to you in terms of, whatever happens next from here, you have stuff in places in the museum that Murray probably should not go. Murray, there are many treatises, and probably people that are worth talking to back at the Penteveral about what you've just found out here.
segments.summary: Brennan notes the significance of their discovery and suggests next steps

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: We need someone with a familiar, something similar, we need to put something living in there that we can see through. Not a person. But someone who can see through other people's eyes.
segments.summary: Bolaire suggests using a familiar to explore the void safely

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Oh. We got a few puppies that I know.
segments.summary: Murray suggests using puppies for the task

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Well. Can't make an omelet without breaking a few puppies, I suppose. Let's just go for it.
segments.summary: Bolaire makes a dark joke about sacrificing animals for research

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Well, all right, hang on. Hang on. Wait, I mean, there are so many questions. First and foremost, what did Thjazi want with this? This was his last dying wish, sitting upon us right here.
segments.summary: Murray raises important questions about Thjazi's motivations

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Why did he want this? And also, what the hell? I mean, it is pretty crazy, that we got this, which has some stink of the Shapers' War, and then we got little angry elf girl over in the other house who also wants a rock, also having to do with the Shapers' War, but then this has got some halfling stuff, and that's got elf stuff. What's going on?
segments.summary: Murray connects the artifact to the Shapers' War and other mysteries

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: What did Thjazi have going on? And did you know something, because I know you know things, Bolaire.
segments.summary: Murray presses Bolaire for information about Thjazi

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: On occasion, I would procure artifacts for him, and in return, he would send me things to look at.
segments.summary: Bolaire reveals his business relationship with Thjazi

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: You just said absolutely fucking nothing.
segments.summary: Murray criticizes Bolaire's vague response

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: I know. Shit.
segments.summary: Bolaire acknowledges being evasive

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Murray? You look out and see sunlight creeping in to the Lloy Wing.
segments.summary: Dawn breaks as their long night of investigation ends

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Oh fuck. Don't you hate it when you accidentally, you're awake all through the sunrise, and now it's light again and now it's going to throw off my circadian rhythm all day.
segments.summary: Murray complains about staying up all night

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: I barely sleep, to be fair.
segments.summary: Bolaire notes his minimal sleep needs

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Too old for this. Not going to sleep for a week now.
segments.summary: Murray laments the effects of their all-nighter

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: He would send me very questionable objects, and I would do my research, and occasionally, I would give them and occasionally, I would give them to people I did not know with no questions asked. I did some dirty work for him. He's dead now, so I hardly think it matters, at this point.
segments.summary: Bolaire reveals more details about his shadowy work for Thjazi

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Why, that makes two of us. Look at that, we got more in common than what you think.
segments.summary: Murray implies she also did questionable work

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Why do I like you?
segments.summary: Bolaire expresses conflicted feelings about Murray

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: You're just awful. Everybody likes me. Stop talking crazy.
segments.summary: Murray playfully defends her likability

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: All right, let's go find out some more shit about this box.
segments.summary: Murray suggests continuing their research

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Murray, you head out, also having your-- It's so funny to say it in a game of D&D, a job. You are the Bursar of the Penteveral. You got to go work.
segments.summary: Murray leaves to attend to her duties as Bursar

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: I've got papers I got to grade today.
segments.summary: Murray mentions her academic responsibilities

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As Murray heads out, Bolaire, you have your private areas of the Lloy wing to check. Moving deeper down into off limits areas of the Lloy Wing, moving past a certain hallway, back towards the vault where there may be some interesting objects to peruse, or texts to talk to here, you keep thinking about the fact that you heard Thaisha say it. Mask, there was a mask in the box. And you think about how long you waited for that tool to make a noise. As you're heading towards the vault, down a side hallway, towards a very special, let's call it cargo area, you see some boxes that were not here when you left for the execution yesterday.
segments.summary: Bolaire discovers unexpected crates in his private area

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Crates, I assume? How large?
segments.summary: Bolaire inquires about the mysterious crates

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: About three and a half feet on each side. Cubes.
segments.summary: Brennan describes the size of the crates

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Fuck. I'm just going to open the crates at this point. Not whatever's inside them, I'm just going to take a look. This is as safe a place to do it as any.
segments.summary: Bolaire decides to investigate the crates

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You open the crates, you look inside, and what you see are wicker-covered ceramic casks. They sort of look like dyers' casks. And you look under the clay lids and see paint leaking out of the top. They're really filled with paint. And there's just one last note left pinned, a little piece of parchment, with a small stiletto dagger that just got left here. And it just says, "For Hal, with all my love."
segments.summary: Bolaire finds casks of paint and a note for Hal

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Oh, you absolute fuckwit. I'm going to reseal it.
segments.summary: Bolaire reacts with frustration and reseals the crates

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: I'm going to go into my private office. I'm going to pull up anything I have, which is probably not much, on the fate of Termina. Whatever I can find about what this thing might be. I'm going to pull as big a book as I can find. I have a little mechanism that will flip the page every 10 minutes. And I sit, and I become perfectly still, and I let the pages flip in front of me, for a few hours.
segments.summary: Bolaire begins researching Termina using his unique reading method

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Gorgeously freaky.
segments.summary: Brennan comments on Bolaire's unusual research method

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Elsewhere in the city, in the neighborhood of Rozigar, the noise of horses. Arrayed and fine on snow white horses, armored soldiers, polearms on their backs, soldiers of the House Davinos. Ride forward, a carriage pulls in front of a building. Emerging from it, golden breastplate, symbol of House Davinos. Across from it, the House of Royce, their liege lords. Silvering mustache and goatee, scars across the cheek, golden helm taken down to a side, a broadsword, a polearm astride the carriage top. General Raimond Davinos exits the carriage, looking at the exterior of The Tangled Sheet, a house of companionship and warm welcome within Dol-Makjar.
segments.summary: General Raimond Davinos arrives at The Tangled Sheet brothel

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Up on the second story, those who are still asleep in this early morning hear the barking of a general of the Sundered Houses outside going, "Julien! Julien!"
segments.summary: General Davinos calls for his son Julien from outside the brothel

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: What state do we find Sir Julien Davinos in?
segments.summary: Brennan asks about Julien's current condition

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: The morning rays of light hitting dried, cracked lids, and lips that are deeply dehydrated. Julien, his hair, dark hair thrown asunder across the wrecked bedsheets, clambers up over the voluptuous tan-skinned woman, and the blonde-haired muscular young man. Who begin to stir as he steps and scrambles and stumbles onto the floor. Grabs a nearby pitcher, and what little bit of liquid in there appears to be nonalcoholic, he chugs desperately as he's beginning to realize how hungover he is, and the sound of his father's voice is not helping.
segments.summary: Julien wakes up severely hungover in bed with two companions

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You chug that. Appearing at the door, you see, one second. You see that Madam Gurlistra appears, an older gnomish woman. She has a goblet of wine in her hand. "Little hair of the dog that bit you?"
segments.summary: Madam Gurlistra offers Julien wine for his hangover

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: Ah, Madam, you are a godsend.
segments.summary: Julien gratefully accepts the offered wine

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "I don't know if you heard your dad's here."
segments.summary: Madam Gurlistra informs Julien of his father's presence

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: I heard. The whole fucking city heard.
segments.summary: Julien acknowledges his father's loud arrival

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Well, we are always grateful for your business, Sir Julien."
segments.summary: Madam Gurlistra expresses appreciation for Julien's patronage

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: Do you know how much of your golden path I was set up for? To have you turn away and throw our entire house's name and-- For friendship with that man. The glory was mine, yes, but you? You sullied everything. So I don't forgive him for what he did to you. As much as I don't forgive him for what he did to Aranessa.
segments.summary: Julien confronts his father about abandoning their family's glory for friendship with Thjazi
segments.location: Inside carriage heading to Palazzo Davinos

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Men do make their own choices, and maybe one day, you will take an interest in why they make those choices."
segments.summary: General Raimond responds philosophically to his son's accusations
segments.location: Inside carriage heading to Palazzo Davinos

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Pulling into the Palazzo Davinos, you emerge from the carriage, walk inside, and see near a fireplace downstairs in a sort of drawing room, The Lady Aranessa, who looks a little panicked. She says, "General Raimond, a word?" He says, "Yes, Lady Aranessa," and walks in. Looking at Aranessa feeling kind of panicked, do you enter the room with them, or--?
segments.summary: They arrive at Palazzo Davinos where Lady Aranessa urgently requests to speak with General Raimond

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: Seeing her face, I definitely would, yes.
segments.summary: Matt decides Julien will enter the room due to Aranessa's panicked expression

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As you walk in, she looks up and says, "The wagons have-- We've confirmed that they were stopped at the Dvalmar Pass." General Raimond goes, "Can we just ride to the Pass?" And she says, "No. The other side. The other side of the mountains before Kavros, they've been behind us. They're days away at this point."
segments.summary: Aranessa reports that wagons were stopped at Dvalmar Pass, days behind them

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: He goes, "That is strange. Why didn't the rear guard not make mention?" He looks and says, "(sighs)" looks over at Julien and you see Aranessa touches his arm and says, "I trust Julien with this information."
segments.summary: General Raimond questions why the rear guard didn't report, Aranessa vouches for trusting Julien

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Your father crosses his arms and says, "Very well, Lady Aranessa. It has come to our attention that there may have been a plot to rescue Thjazi Fang." Aranessa looks at you with a look of like: We know what we heard at that funeral. And that's not--
segments.summary: General Raimond reveals intelligence about a plot to rescue Thjazi Fang, referencing what they overheard at the funeral

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: Not a very good one.
segments.summary: Matt comments that the rescue plot wasn't very good

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: He says, "Disturbing things have come to us. The Tachonis are currently searching for a member of their family, one who dwells primarily here in Dol-Makjar. If rumors are correct, it is possible that he knows something of this plan, in which case he was acting in direct contradiction of his family. It may be to our benefit if we can find the young boy before anyone else does."
segments.summary: General Raimond explains that the Tachonis family is searching for one of their own in Dol-Makjar who may know about the rescue plot

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: He looks to Aranessa.
segments.summary: Julien looks to Aranessa for her response

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Aranessa nods and says "It would be wise. He is, I believe, in danger."
segments.summary: Aranessa agrees and expresses concern that the young Tachonis is in danger

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: Then I'm at your service, Lady Aranessa.
segments.summary: Julien formally offers his service to Lady Aranessa

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: General Raimond nods and says, "If you find him, I would bring him here for the time being. Don't let anyone see you bring him here, but we should get a chance to talk with him if we can, to understand what may have happened. And we are not going toe to toe with the Tachonis. We are just trying to understand what happened and hopefully advocate on the young boy's behalf in case there had been a misunderstanding, which given the insanity of the rumor, there must be."
segments.summary: General Raimond gives instructions to bring the Tachonis boy secretly for questioning while avoiding conflict with the family

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: He turns to Aranessa and says, "Given the gravity of this and the carriages, should we postpone the gala tomorrow night?" She turns and says, "No, no. Appearances are everything. Absolutely. If anything, invite more people. We should have it be as much of a to-do as we possibly can. in fact--"
segments.summary: General Raimond suggests postponing the gala but Aranessa insists on proceeding with even more fanfare for appearances

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: (retches)
segments.summary: Julien suddenly retches

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Julien, are you all right?"
segments.summary: Someone asks if Julien is alright after he retches

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: I'm fine.
segments.summary: Julien dismisses concern about his condition

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Your father walks over to the mantle and says, "Julien, are you going to be able to do this?"
segments.summary: General Raimond questions if Julien is capable of handling the mission

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: Always.
segments.summary: Julien affirms his readiness for the task

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: He says, "Good. You are my eldest son." And he splashes a full pitcher of water in your face. "And I love you. To it, then!"
segments.summary: General Raimond splashes water on Julien's face as a form of tough love before sending him on his mission

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: He reaches and tightens the demi-gauntlet on his left hand. You hear the metal plates kind of clinking and squeezing into place. (sighs)
segments.summary: Julien adjusts his demi-gauntlet, preparing for action

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Wipe yourself off. You head forth from this place.
segments.summary: Brennan transitions Julien away from the scene

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Such a loving observation as "You're my eldest son." (laughter) That's it.
segments.summary: Marisha comments sarcastically on the father's cold way of expressing affection

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: It's a great family dynamic. Super healthy.
segments.summary: Matt sarcastically comments on the dysfunctional family relationship

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Super, super healthy. We arrive in the woods outside of Dol-Makjar. Robbie, where do we find Kattigan outside of the city here?
segments.summary: Brennan transitions to Kattigan's scene outside Dol-Makjar

segments.speaker: Robbie (Kattigan)
segments.content: Where you'd find him most nights, he's just sleeping out. Found a little patch where there's a split in the canopy where he's been. And it was a rough night's sleep. Sweat, alcohol, pouring out into his clothes that are already well-worn. He's got Wulferic underneath the back of his head. Arms folded, legs crossed. And as that first little splint of morning sunlight comes through, it just catches him in the eye. Mm, oh god. And he wakes up and then starts to stand and he's shuffling through the memories of last night. And it's pretty foggy.
segments.summary: Kattigan wakes up hungover in the woods with his companion Wulferic, struggling to remember the previous night
segments.location: Woods outside Dol-Makjar - Kattigan's sleeping spot

segments.speaker: Robbie (Kattigan)
segments.content: I mean, he recalls, there was an altercation, he remembers that he was at a funeral. He remembers why he was there. But he went pretty hard the rest of the evening on the streets by himself. And as he stands up and him and Wulferic get themselves settled for the day, cracks his neck a bit and it sounds-- when he moves his shoulders and cracks his neck, it sounds like you're like stepping on empty snail shells. Everything in him crackles, and no cartilage left much to speak of.
segments.summary: Kattigan remembers fragments of the funeral and altercation while his aged body creaks and pops

segments.speaker: Robbie (Kattigan)
segments.content: And he's got a leather bandolier on his chest that's full of tinctures and herbs and he takes a little tiny snuffbox out and (sniffs). Ah. Wulferic sneezes behind him. As he's sifting through these memories, he's trying to find that mooring to hold onto about what the night was all about. Because he's feeling through his pockets and they're empty. No gold, no food. His water skin's empty, even. And he doesn't know what to do with himself. He's lost again.
segments.summary: Kattigan takes medicine from his bandolier and realizes he's completely broke and directionless

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "of resources. It has come to the attention of the House Einfasen in its seat on the Chamber of Lords-Advisory to the Revolutionary Council that the public funds that the public funds have been somewhat diminished of late. And it is the opinion of myself And it is the opinion of myself as a member of the Chamber of the Lords-Advisory is that the Revolutionary Guard has for too long been tasked with the sole duty of protecting the city and its peoples. I would hate to think that your important tasks would go, shall we say, interrupted, or that you would not have the resources you need to be able to do what you must. We are discussing ways in which certain struggling offices of the Revolutionary Guard can be closed to see those resources better served elsewhere. And in my estimation, there is no group within the city that compares to the Arcane Marshals. Your services are absolutely necessary and vital for the continued safety of the city."
segments.summary: Lord Knight continues his proposal about consolidating Revolutionary Guard resources

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: I'm glad to hear that, sir.
segments.summary: Azune responds diplomatically to the Lord Knight's proposal

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "If there is any use I can be to you, you need only call on me and my house. We would be only too happy to serve."
segments.summary: Lord Knight offers his house's services

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: A question, if I may.
segments.summary: Azune requests to ask a question

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Of course."
segments.summary: Lord Knight grants permission for the question

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: These offices that you foresee would close. Is there-- Whatever little resources have been dedicated to them, what would that mean for those resources if those offices are closed?
segments.summary: Azune asks about the fate of resources from closed offices

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Those resources would be reassigned to offices of the Revolutionary Guard that are, shall we say, more efficient in their use of those resources."
segments.summary: Lord Knight explains resource reallocation plans

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Understood.
segments.summary: Azune acknowledges the explanation

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "The Arcane Marshals is extremely effective at a, shall we say, type of safety of the peoples of Dol-Makjar that cannot be easily recreated by any other division. Whereas Gate Guardians or Revolutionary Guard patrolmen, those tasks can absolutely be handled by men at arms of the various Houses of the Chamber of Lords-Advisory."
segments.summary: Lord Knight explains why Arcane Marshals are valuable while other units are replaceable

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: And what role will you play in that?
segments.summary: Azune asks about the Lord Knight's role in the new arrangement

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "A security overseer."
segments.summary: Lord Knight reveals his intended position

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Understood.
segments.summary: Azune acknowledges the Lord Knight's role

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "As a Lord Knight, it would be my honor to join you side by side in keeping this city safe."

segments.content: 12, 12 for Kattigan. Hell yeah. Thimble, these people are not creative, and as many times before, you hear the whistling right behind you of someone with a burlap sack, and that's where we're going to say goodbye. (exclaiming)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Having been watered and fed, Teor Pridesire has been ushered out of the Villa Aurora, and after much business, dealing with a quick meeting with House Einfasen and some comings and goings, Sam, what do you think Wicander would get up to that in a normal day, after having signed up for Teor to maybe begin to be your assigned bodyguard, this holy man, but in a normal day, what do you think you would get up to?
segments.summary: DM transitions to Wicander's scene, asking about his normal activities after Teor left

segments.speaker: Sam (Wicander)
segments.content: Oh, well, in a normal day-- This isn't a normal day.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Or on this day, what would you get up to, yeah?
segments.summary: DM clarifies the question about today's activities

segments.speaker: Sam (Wicander)
segments.content: In a normal day, I think I would-- I have duties. I have things to take care of at the various temples. And there is the matter of that shipment of Filament that was outside, this glowing liquid that was being jostled around, I want to make sure that that is being cared for and delivered to the right place. There's always the teaching of Tyranny and making sure that she is being brought to the Light and making sure that she's doing her studies. I don't know if she's with me now or not.
segments.summary: Wicander describes his duties including temple work, Filament shipment, and teaching Tyranny

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I believe she is.

segments.speaker: Sam (Wicander)
segments.content: Okay. Yes.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: After a long day dealing with the accident, there is a knock at your study door as the sun begins to set.

segments.speaker: Sam (Wicander)
segments.content: Maybe I'm in the middle of explaining to her: As you know, the Candescent Creed believes that the universe is a river of light and we are but vessels riding in this river. We have solved the ancient secrets, though, and we can distill the light energy into liquid Filament and that Filament can be used in rituals and--

segments.content: How?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Beams of light emerge unbidden from his lidless eyes as two beams of light funnel into the base of the Prismatic Retort. (whooshing) The runes of the sarcophagus alight and they begin to open.
segments.summary: Occtis's eyes emit beams of light that funnel into the Prismatic Retort, causing the runes to activate

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Both of you, I need a strength saving throw.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Sure, that's what we do. Hey, pretty good.

segments.content: Dirty 20.

segments.content: 15. Tyranny, you stand strong. Wicander, you are thrown back 10 feet.

segments.content: Sure. It's all right, I can see better back here.

segments.content: I go and I, hold on, it's okay.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You look up, and as your eyes adjust, you see your father kneeling, reasserting, and re-fixing the blindfold on his face as the Retort opens, gleaming light. This is not a sarcophagus, it's an iron maiden, and within it is a 30-foot tall angel chained with taps like that that removes the sap from maple trees, gushing blood out as the angel chained with its head against the inner workings, its featherless wings spread out and splayed against the inside of the machine.
segments.summary: The Prismatic Retort reveals itself to be an iron maiden containing a massive chained angel being drained of blood

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Roars out like a screaming titan. As rows and rows of unpointed teeth within its mouth gnash furiously. It blasts forth bilious gleaming blood over its shining body. Claws and feet reaching forward against the chains.
segments.summary: The angel screams and thrashes against its chains, bleeding profusely

segments.speaker: Yanessa (DM)
segments.content: Wicky, I'd like you to meet your grandfather.

segments.content: That's all for this episode of Critical Role.
